content:
Yield: 0.193 g (52 %). Anal. Calc. for C24H22N2O2: C, 77.8; H, 6.1; N, 7.6. Found: C, 77.3; H, 6.0; N, 7.5 %. IR (KBr, cm−1) 1636 ν(C=N), 2800–3100 ν(C–H), 1599 ν(C=C)Ar. EI-Mass: (m/z, M+) 370 [L1]+. 1H NMR (CDCl3, ppm) 3.513–4.154 (4H,CH2–CH2), 5.095–5.266 (4H, 2CH2O), 6.832–7.982(12H, Ar–H), 8.644, 8.675 (2H, −CH=N). 13C NMR (CDCl3, ppm) 62.00, 62.12, 68.27, 68.66, 122.27–157.56, 158.12, 158.18 (Fig. 1).

L<sup>4</sup>

Yield: 64 %. Anal. Calc. for C25H24N2O2 (MW: 384.5): C, 78.10; H, 62.9; N, 7.29. Found: C, 77.2; H, 6.1; N, 7.4 %. IR (KBr, cm−1): 1635 δ (C=N), 2800–3100 δ (C–H), 1599 δ (C=C)Ar. 1H NMR (CDCl3, ppm) δ = 1.31 (s, 3H), 3.7 (s, 4H), 6.82–7.96(m, 12H), 8.59(m, H), 8.63(m, H); 13C NMR (CDCl3, ppm) δ = 22.1, 58.2, 66.36,72.4, 112.64, 120.92, 124.85, 128.84, 130.1, 132.2, 141.1, 160.3, 163.4, 164.5. EI-MS (m/z, %): 384.5 (36 %), (Fig. 1).

[Cu<sub>2</sub>L<sub arrange="stack">2</sub><sup arrange="stack">1′</sup>](NO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>

Yield: 0.237 g (41 %). Anal. Calc. for [Cu2L21′](NO3)2) (MW: 577.5): C, 37.4; H, 3.8; N, 14.5. Found: C, 37.3; H, 4.1; N, 14.4 %. IR (KBr, cm−1) 3300, 3235 ν(NH2), 1642 ν(C=N), 1384 ν(NO3).

[Cu<sub>2</sub>L<sub arrange="stack">2</sub><sup arrange="stack">2′</sup>](NO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>

Yield: 0.279 g (46 %). Anal. Calc. for [Cu2L22′](NO3)2) (MW: 605.5): C, 39.7; H, 4.3; N, 13.9. Found: C, 39.3; H, 4.5; N, 13.7 %. IR (KBr, cm−1) 3122, 3215 ν(NH2), 1623 ν(C=N), 1384 ν(NO3−).

[Cu<sub>2</sub>L<sub arrange="stack">2</sub><sup arrange="stack">3′</sup>](NO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>

Yield: 0.285 g (43 %). Anal. Calc. for [Cu2L23′](NO3)2) (MW: 661.6): C, 37.4; H, 3.8; N, 14.5. Found: C, 37.6; H, 3.7; N, 14.3 %. IR (KBr, cm−1) 3206, 3299 ν (NH2), 1625 ν(C=N), 1384 ν(NO3−).

General method of Synthesis of Ni(II) complexes

Ni(II) metal salts (0.25 mmol) were dissolved in dry methanol (10 mL) and slowly added to a stirred boiling solution (20 mmol) of L1 or L4 (0.3 mmol) in the same solvent with refluxing continued for 6 h. The solution was reduced to ca. 5 ml and the precipitate was filtered and washed by diethyl ether and dried in vacuum. Crystals suitable of [NiL1(CH3CN)2(CH3OH)2](ClO4)2 for X-ray diffraction studies were obtained by slow diffusion of Et2O vapor into the MeOH/MeCN solution of the above solid.

[NiL<sup>1</sup>(CH<sub>3</sub>CN)<sub>2</sub>(CH<sub>3</sub>OH)<sub>2</sub>](ClO<sub>4</sub>)<sub>2</sub>

Yield: 49 %. Anal. Calc. for: C30 H40 Cl2 N4 Ni O12: C, 32.90; H, 4.5; N, 6.0. Found: C, 32.89; H, 4.32; N, 5.78 %. IR (KBr, cm−1): 1651υ (C=), 1100 υ(ClO4−).

[NiL<sup>4</sup>] (NO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>

Yield: 35 % (0.05 g). Anal. Calc. for C25H24N4O8Ni: C, 52.90; H, 4.30; N, 9.90. Found: C, 52.50; H, 4.60; N, 9.70 %. IR (KBr, cm−1): 1618 υ (C=N), 1384, υ(NO3−).

Physical measurements

IR spectra were measured on a Perkin Elmer FT-IRGX spectrophotometer. Mass spectra were recorded using VARIAN 3400 GC-Mass spectrometer. NMR spectra were measured on Bruker DPX 400 spectrometers. Elemental analyses were performed in a Carlo-Erba EA microanalyser.
